column3: Welcome & get ready for the course
column6: Learners can access the Posit Cloud workspace for the course.

column3: Welcome & get ready for the course
column6: Learners can use the Element chat to introduce themselves.

column3: Welcome & get ready for the course
column6: Learners can open an issue on GitHub and tag the course instructor.

column3: Welcome & get ready for the course
column6: Learners can clone a repository from GitHub and use the GitHub PAT to push a commit from their local repository to GitHub.

column3: Welcome & get ready for the course
column6: Learners can navigate the course website and understand the learning objectives of the course.

column3: Data science lifecycle & Exploratory data analysis using visualization
column6: Learners can identify four components of a Quarto file (YAML, code chunk, R code, markdown).

column3: Data science lifecycle & Exploratory data analysis using visualization
column6: Learners can list the six elements of the data science lifecycle.

column3: Data science lifecycle & Exploratory data analysis using visualization
column6: Learners can describe the four main aesthetic mappings that can be used to visualise data using the ggplot2 R Package.

column3: Data science lifecycle & Exploratory data analysis using visualization
column6: Learners can control the colour scaling applied to a plot using colour as an aesthetic mapping.

column3: Data science lifecycle & Exploratory data analysis using visualization
column6: Learners can compare three different geoms (bar/col, histogram, point) and their use case.
Learners can apply ten functions from the dplyr R Package to generate a subset of data for use in a table or plot.

column3: Data import & Data organization in spreadsheets
column6: Learners can import data from files in CSV and XLSX format located in sub-directories of the root directory.

column3: Data import & Data organization in spreadsheets
column6: Learners can explain the difference between the vector class character and the vector class factor.

column3: Data import & Data organization in spreadsheets
column6: Learners can discuss the difference between unprocessed raw data, processed analysis-ready data, and data underlying a publication.

column3: Data import & Data organization in spreadsheets
column6: Learners can apply 12 principles for data organisation in spreadsheets to the layout of a provided dataset.
Learners can apply functions from dplyr to change specific values of a variable in a dataframe.
Learners can apply functions from the lubridate package to convert dates not in ISO 8601 to the date class in R.
Learners can apply functions from knitr and gt package to display and cross-reference tables in HTML output reports.
Learners can understand the relevance a data dictionary to describe variable names in a data set.
Learners can identify different ways of accessing a vector from a dataframe
Learners can list the four main atomic vector types in R.
Learners can apply functions from the tidyr R Package to transform their data from a wide to a long format and vice versa.

column6: Learners can cross-reference figures and tables within an Quarto file.

Learners can explain the differences between and limitations of each data type
